title: This doesn't seem fair at all
body: After waiting in queue for 53 minutes, I'm told I will receive a penalty for leaving?!?!  How does that even make sense, I expected a quick queue, but this is insane and now you want to PENALIZE me for having to wait for an hour?!  I know sometimes queues can be long but not only is this frustrating, telling me im going to be penalized for leaving is even more absurd.

replies.body: Something's missing from your story.  Never in the history of team builder have a I seen a queue over 40 minutes.  The longest I've ever waited in a duo queue was 20 - were you a pre-made 5 man trying to use team builder?

It honestly shouldnt matter if it's a premade 5. I have frequently done premade 4 and 5 man team builders with friends and the queues have been almost near instant. A penalty shouldnt be given out if someone wants to cancel after a certain amount of time. If that type of punishment is allowed what you're basically telling the player is that they must wait to find a group once fully assembled, no matter how long the queue takes. There should have been counter measures for this already in place.

All that means is other 4 and 5 man premades were queuing up at the same time. 

They try to match 5 mans against other 5 mans. If there are no other 5 mans, or other suitable matches then you wait. There is nothing else to it.

Well I hope the system doesnt work like that to look for specifically made parties. Any team of 5 in Team builder that is ready to go should be paired with another team of 5. Whether or not you guys searched for other positions or no should not make any difference in the availability of matches.

Its similar to blinds and draft when they try to match teams with premades with other teams with premades. When you have a 5 man you wait to be  matched with another 5 man with a comparable team MMR (average mmr of teammates). TB knows if you are in a premade or not (since you had to invite them instead of wait for players) and its unfair to match a 5 man premade against 5 solo queue players. They are matched with each other (trying to consider team MMR) such that the game is as fair as possible.

Well that is all good and well, but the problem I see here is if Team A has been queued for 53 minutes, and Team B never shows up. Why get penalized for wanting to leave after all that time? How does it in anyway affect the other team, or yours for that matter. Because I am sure your team knows why you want to leave, there should be no penalty for leaving for searching for a game.

I've waiting over 40 minutes so many times.
